block.p: All times are Eastern daylight
8 p.m. Representative Jim Kolbe of Arizona on international trade.
Ave Bie, the Wisconsin public service commissioner, on the importance of a sound national energy policy.
All times are Eastern daylight
8 p.m. Representative Jim Kolbe of Arizona on international trade.
Ave Bie, the Wisconsin public service commissioner, on the importance of a sound national energy policy.
Theodore Roosevelt IV, the great-grandson of President Theodore Roosevelt, on the need for conserving natural resources.
Gen. H. Norman Schwarzkopf via satellite on military readiness.
Former Senator Bob Dole leads a salute to all American veterans.
9 p.m.
Patricia Funderburk Ware, president of the Preserving Family Well-Being Foundation, on the fight against AIDS and H.I.V.
Frank Ellis, a community leader from Kansas City, Mo., on safety and security in American neighborhoods.
Jack Cowley, the national director of operations for an Oklahoma City prison ministry, on his program.
Condoleezza Rice, Governor Bush's international-affairs adviser, on international relations.
Elizabeth Dole on strength through compassion.
Senator Chuck Hagel of Nebraska introduces Senator John McCain.
Mr. McCain on the importance of military strength.
TV Schedule Major networks ABC -- (Channel 7 in New York) 10 p.m. to 11 p.m.
CBS -- (Channel 2 in New York) Segments on ''48 Hours'' 10 p.m. to 11 p.m.
CNN 7 p.m. to 9 p.m. and 10 p.m. to 11 p.m. -- live coverage
9 p.m. to 10 p.m. and midnight to 1 A.M. -- ''Larry King Live''
11 p.m. to midnight -- post-convention special
FOX -- (Channel 5 in New York) No special coverage
FOX NEWS CHANNEL 8 p.m. to 11 p.m. -- live coverage Midnight to 1 a.m. -- convention wrapup
MSNBC
8 p.m. to 11 p.m. -- live coverage
11 p.m. to 1 a.m. -- wrapup
NBC (Channel 4 in New York)
Segments on ''Dateline'' 10 p.m. to 11 p.m.
PBS (Channel 13 in New York)
8 p.m. to 11 p.m. -- live coverage
Other networks
COMEDY CENTRAL 11 p.m. to 11:30 p.m. -- ''Daily Show with Jon Stewart''
C-SPAN 7 p.m. to convention conclusion -- live gavel to gavel
On the Web Party Sites
www.gopconvention.com
www.georgewbush.com
www.rnc.org
www.nrcc.org
www.nrsc.org

News Organizations Many major news organizations are planning to use live video from the television pool coverage by C-Span on their Web sites that will be the same as that broadcast by the television networks. Other Web-based news sites will provide similar coverage and NationalJournal.com, which is normally open only to subscribers, will have open access during the conventions and provide a guide to convention news on the Web.
In addition, America Online will offer video from the convention hall 24 hours a day, while Pseudo.com will have cameras providing a 360-degree view of the hall.

The New York Times On the Web Additional coverage is available to computer users through The New York Times on the Web, which will have continual live video from the convention. The New York Times on the Web and ABCNEWS.com will also have daily Webcasts at 1:30 p.m. and 8 p.m. Those remain available throughout the day at The New York Times on the Web: www.nytimes.com/politics
THE REPUBLICANS
